name: inset
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
something positioned within a larger object: The map has an inset (= a small extra map) in the top corner that shows the city centre in more detail. The long black wool coat has gold satin insets along its back and sleeves.

(of an object) having something positioned within it: inset with He bought her a gold necklace inset with rubies. The large mullioned window inset with heraldic glass appears to be early 16th century.

to position something within a larger object: Small lights were inset into the side of the stair treads. When the lens is inset inside the fixture, the light is directed where it is needed.
